def.p: An expression of a discrete item of clinical (or clinically related) information that is recorded because of its relevance to the care of a patient. Clinical information can be expressed with different levels of granularity and therefore the extent and detail conveyed in a single statement may vary. To be regarded as a clinical statement, a concept must be associated with a patient in a manner which makes clear:

item.p: In the case of an observation, its mood and presence, absence or value
In the case of a procedure, its mood and status

def.p: This clarity may be achieved by

item.p: Implicit application of defaults ONLY where explicitly modeled rules state the appropriate defaults.
